result.execSummary:
The defendant Norma R Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 10/3/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.
With Huber.  Release for standard conditions including elder care for her ill uncle.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norma R Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Norma R Smith in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest alford plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  20 Days Huber - Huber with standard release conditions (to include elder care for her ill uncle) -  Defendant to report to jail on 9/6/16 by 5:00 p.m. 
            
     COSTS:  $253.00 - to be paid at $25.00 per month,  commencing 10/3/16, alternate 5 days jail if not paid
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Norma R Smith did not appear.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek states that Defendant had a family medical emergency and that is why Defendant is not here today.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Norma R Smith in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Norma R Smith in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kershek requests another hearing date to review materials from the State. Court sets. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with co actor, victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to have no contact with any Kohl's Department Store.

Defendant Norma R Smith in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
